business.headline: Oyo races to launch IPO as debt repayment deadline approaches: ReportOyo has been flirting with an IPO for years, but Covid-19 wrecked its earlier ambitions. Now, the hotel chain is talking to bankers again, targeting a valuation of up to $5 billion, according to sources.
Citigroup's copy-paste error nearly led to $6 billion transferThe said error occurred during an attempted transfer of funds between the bank's internal accounts.

Trump's tariffs spark trade war: Will global economy pay a heavy price?Financial experts have warned that Donald Trump's tariffs could ignite a global trade war, disrupting supply chains and jeopardizing international trade flows built over decades.

Trade war heats up: China strikes back at US after Trump's tariffs China's tariffs on the US come after President Donald Trump announced an additional 10% tariff on Chinese goods, bringing the total tariff level to 20%.

Is stock market still overvalued? Warren Buffett's key indicator signals cautionSensex and Nifty have corrected nearly 15% from their all-time high and, despite these corrections, there are concerns that the stock markets remain expensive, and further downside could be possible.

Warren Buffett slams Trump's tariffs: They're an act of warWarren Buffett's comments come as Donald Trump has pushed ahead with new tariffs. Starting Tuesday, his administration will slap a 25% tariff on goods from Canada and Mexico. The US President is also hiking tariffs on Chinese imports, raising the rate from 10% to 20%.

Reliance Industries says oil ministry raised $2.81 billion demand in gas dispute caseOn February 14, a division bench at Delhi High Court ruled against Reliance and its partners in a dispute regarding extraction of gas in a deepwater field in India's KG D6 block in the Krishna Godavari basin in the country's eastern coast.
Sensex, Nifty in red as Dalal Street bloodbath continues: 3 reasons whyThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 265.30 points to 72,820.64, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 104.85 points to 22,014.45 as of 9.40 am.
Sensex, Nifty open in red as Trump's tariffs trigger global markets meltdownThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 368.03 points to 72,717.91, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 136.30 points to 21,982.70 as of 9:16 AM.
Honda to build next Civic in US, skips Mexico over tariff concerns: ReportHonda has chosen Mexico because of rising costs that were making it tough to produce the car in Indiana, the US and Canada.

Global markets jittery ahead of Trump tariffs: How will it impact Dalal Street?A decline in US stocks was witnessed, triggered by the latest tariff announcement from US President Donald Trump spooking Wall Street.

Tata Capital eyes India's biggest IPO, seeks $11 billion valuation: ReportLast week, Tata Capital's board approved the listing of up to 230 million shares, including an offer for sale by existing shareholders.

No-cost EMIs: The real cost behind 'zero interest' deals and who benefits? The idea of breaking down a large payment into smaller, interest-free instalments sounds attractive. However, there is more to these schemes than meets the eye.

Bitcoin up by 7%, Cardano jumps by 47% on Trump's US crypto reserves newsAs a result, on March 3, the total crypto market volume witnessed a jump of 197.62% from the previous day, and stood at $206.77 billion.

Paytm under ED lens for FEMA violations, gets Rs 611 crore noticeThe investigation agency said that Paytm failed to follow the rules under the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) while making an investment in Singapore.
IRCTC and IRFC get 'Navratna' status. Here's what it meansIRCTC has become the 25th Navratna among Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSEs), while IRFC is now the 26th.
PF UPI withdrawal rules: How to withdraw EPF money via UPI To withdraw your PF money, it is essential to complete the KYC process for your EPF account.
Sensex, Nifty erase early gains to end flat in volatile tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 21,85 points to end at 73,176.25, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 5.40 points to close at 22,119.30.

Paytm shares recover after 4% drop on ED notice over FEMA violationsPaytm earlier informed stock exchanges that it had received a show cause notice from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on February 28 at 7:27 PM. The notice, dated 27 February, was related to alleged violations of FEMA rules between 2015 and 2019.

Why has Radhika Gupta compared Nifty to Shah Rukh Khan? Details hereNifty has hit its longest losing streak in 29 years, wiping out Rs 90 lakh crore in investor wealth since hitting its peak in September. The Sensex has fallen over 12% since its September 2024 all-time high, when it touched its peak at 85,478.25.

Smallcap and midcap stocks are in free fall. What should investors do?The broader market saw heavy selling pressure last month, dragging the BSE Smallcap index down 15%—its first double-digit monthly decline since the pandemic sell-off—while the Nifty Midcap 100 fell over 10%.

India's manufacturing growth hits 14-month low in February on soft demandThe HSBC final India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index, compiled by S&P Global, fell to 56.3 in February - its lowest since December 2023 - from 57.7 in January. A preliminary estimate was much higher at 57.1.

Government looks to enhance PLI scheme to boost exports. Details hereIntroduced in April 2020, the PLI scheme has drawn substantial investment in 14 sectors, attracting original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and contract manufacturers to scale up production.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares fell over 5% to hit 52-week low todayIn the past five days, Ola Electric shares have lost more than 9%, and in six months, it has crashed a whopping 52%. Since the start of this year, the stock is down over 37%.

Explained: Why Reliance share price tumbled over 3% today Foreign investors have been aggressively selling Indian equities, dragging down heavyweight stocks like RIL. The company's market value has shrunk as a result, reflecting the broader negative sentiment in the market.

Ola Electric likely to cut over 1,000 jobs amid rising losses: ReportThe job cuts will affect multiple departments, including procurement, fulfilment, customer relations, and charging infrastructure. Ola Electric shares also fell 5% to hit its 52-week low of Rs 54.

How often can taxpayers switch between new and old tax regime? Salaried employees can select their tax regime at the start of each financial year. If no preference is given, employers will deduct tax under the new regime by default.
Sensex, Nifty erases early gains: Why is stock market falling today? By 11:13 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex had fallen 388.70 points to 72,809.40, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 111.50 points to 22,013.30.

Google co-founder shares 'sweet spot' of work hours for employees. Check detailsGoogle co-founder Sergey Brin expressed concern about employees working less than the recommended hours or doing the bare minimum.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as GDP growth boosts sentiment; IT, auto stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 142.87 points to 73,340.97, while the NSE Nifty50 added 48.55 points to 22,173.25 as of 9:30 AM.

Crypto market surges $300 billion after Trump names 5 coins for strategic reserveThe total cryptocurrency market has risen about 10%, or more than USD 300 billion, in the hours since Trump's announcement, according to CoinGecko, a cryptocurrency data and analysis company.

Sebi says will challenge order directing case against Madhabi Buch, othersCalling the complainant "frivolous and habitual litigant", Sebi said that it would initiate appropriate legal steps to challenge the special court order to file a case against former chief Madhabi Puri Buch and others.

Adani Group revives US investment plans amid ongoing bribery case: ReportFor now, Adani Group's US footprint remains minimal. Past talks with American companies about petrochemical projects in Texas never led to major deals.

Paytm clarifies FEMA allegations on acquired subsidiaries. Details hereThe company is seeking legal advice and will take necessary steps to resolve the matter through appropriate regulatory processes in line with applicable laws.

US food delivery firm Grubhub lays off 500 employees. Here's whyGrubhub is laying off as many as 500 employees, over 20 per cent of its workforce, following its acquisition by Wonder. The layoffs, spanning all departments, aim to streamline operations as the company integrates with its new parent.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey assumes charge as 11th Sebi chairmanTuhin Kanta Pandey took charge as the 11th Sebi chairman, succeeding Madhabi Puri Buch, who completed her tenure. A former Finance Secretary, Pandey has been appointed for three years.

India to remain fastest growing major economy with 6.5% growth in FY26: IMFIndia's strong economic performance, the IMF said, provides an opportunity for the country to advance critical and challenging structural reforms to realise the ambition of becoming an advanced economy by 2047.

From record highs to a five-month slide: Where are Sensex, Nifty headed?From record highs to relentless losses, Dalal Street's dream run has turned into a nightmare in just a few months. Is there any relief in sight for investors or is there more pain ahead?

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath flags sharp drop in trading activity amid market crashThe stock market fell sharply on Friday, with the Sensex dropping 1,414 points and the Nifty slipping below 22,150. The heavy selling wiped out nearly Rs 9 lakh crore in market value.

Citigroup employee's typo nearly led to $81 trillion blunder. Details hereThe payment was initially overlooked by two employees before a third employee caught it. Citi later reported the incident as a 'near miss' to the Federal Reserve and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC).

entertainment.headline: Singer Dolly Parton's husband Carl Dean dies at 82Carl Dean, husband of Dolly Parton and inspiration for her hit song, Jolene, has died at the age of 82.

Blackpink's Lisa on her new album Alter Ego: Want people to feel empoweredLisa of Blackpink recently spoke about her new solo album, Alter Ego. In a virtual panel discussion, the singer shared her desire to make listeners feel empowered with her new album.

Taarak Mehta actor Deepti Sadhwani turns showstopper at Milan Fashion WeekTaarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah actor Deepti Sadhwani turned showstopper at Milan Fashion Week. The actor shared stunning photos from her rampwalk.

Kaam Idhar Udhar Hogaya: YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani on India's Got Latent rowYouTuber Ashish Chanchlani got emotional in his first video after his appearance on comedian Samay Raina's India's Got Latent show.

Maharani 4 teaser: Huma Qureshi returns as Rani Bharti to safeguard BiharActor Huma Qureshi is set to return as Rani Bharti in Maharani Season 4. The makers announced the news with the teaser of the upcoming gripping series.

TV show Tenali Rama set catches fire, shoot haltedA fire broke out on the set of TV show Tenali Rama due to a generator malfunction, halting production. There were no casualties, but the set suffered damage and repairs are underway.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan reunites with Ludo co-actor Inayat in feel-good filmThe trailer of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma's upcoming dance-drama Be Happy was released today. Directed by Remo D'Souza, the heartfelt film will premiere on Prime Video on March 14.

BTS' J-hope's Seoul concert: New song, fan proposal and special appearance by JinBTS member and rapper J-hope recently held a concert in Seoul which was attended by his close friend and singer Kim Seokjin (Jin). The concert was one big event for the fans as it consisted of many other surprises besides the central performance by the artiste.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter: Jeet and Prosenjit announce release date with fun clipThe next installment of Netflix's critically acclaimed thriller series Khakee, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter will premiere on Netflix in March. The makers of the show announced its release date with a fun video.

Anupamaa actor Sudhanshu Pandey breaks silence on rumoured feud with Rupali GangulyActor Sudhanshu Pandey has addressed the ongoing rumours about a feud with his Anupamaa co-star Rupali Ganguly. In an interview, he clarified the situation and dismissed the speculations.

BRIT Awards 2025: Charli XCX wins album of the year, full winners list hereCharli XCX emerged as a major winner at the Brit Awards 2025, securing multiple accolades. Artists including Sabrina Carpenter and Billie Eilish also took home some of the biggest awards of the night.

Honey Singh's Millionaire Delhi concert: A night of nostalgia, iconic hitsHoney Singh's Delhi concert was packed with nostalgic hits, emotional tributes, surprise guests, and exclusive remixes. The rapper promised bigger things ahead as his Millionaire Tour continues.

general news.headline: Calling someone 'Miyan-Tiyan' in poor taste, but not an offence: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court ruled that calling someone "Miyan-Tiyan" or 'Pakistani' is inappropriate but not a criminal offence under Section 298, as it doesn't meet the legal threshold for hurting religious sentiments.

Maharashtra minister resigns after aide arrested in sarpanch murder caseMoments after Dhananjay Munde's resignation, the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader broke his silence and stated that he had stepped down due to health reasons as well, while condemning the brutal murder of the village headman of Massajog.

China, Canada, Mexico retaliate after Trump's trade tariffs: Have plan B, C, DCanada and Mexico have launched retaliatory tariffs after President Donald Trump confirmed sweeping trade measures starting Tuesday, escalating North American tensions. Markets reacted sharply, with the S&P 500 index dropping 2 per cent in afternoon trading on Monday.

Congress leader hits back amid fat-shaming row, cites Kangana Ranaut's old tweetCongress spokesperson Shama Mohamed pulled up an old tweet by BJP MP Kangana Ranaut, in which the Bollywood actor's now-deleted tweet, bashing Rohit Sharma for his stand on the farmers' protests back in 2021.

Video: PM Modi plays with orangutan, feeds lion cub at Vantara animal shelterIn a video, the Prime Minister was seen closely interacting and spending time with various species of animals which have been rehabilitated there.

Relief for ex-Sebi chief Madhabi Buch, court pauses registration of caseThe Bombay High Court on Tuesday paused the registration of an FIR case against former Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and other officials based on a lower court order.

Semi-final preview: With Dubai edge, India aim to clear familiar Aussie hurdleIndia vs Australia, semi-final preview: India head into the Champions Trophy knockout game as favourites, backed by form and familiar conditions in Dubai. But despite missing key players, Australia remain a formidable knockout force, ready to challenge once again.

Trump pauses military aid to Ukraine days after Oval Office spat with ZelenskyyUS President Donald Trump has directed a "pause" to US assistance to Ukraine after a disastrous Oval Office meeting as he seeks to pressure Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to engage in peace talks with Russia.

Pope Francis suffers respiratory insufficiency caused by bronchospasm: What is it?Pope Francis, who has been in the hospital since February 14 for double pneumonia, experienced two episodes of acute respiratory insufficiency, caused by bronchospasm.
Citigroup's copy-paste error nearly led to $6 billion transferThe said error occurred during an attempted transfer of funds between the bank's internal accounts.

Warren Buffett slams Trump's tariffs: They're an act of warWarren Buffett's comments come as Donald Trump has pushed ahead with new tariffs. Starting Tuesday, his administration will slap a 25% tariff on goods from Canada and Mexico. The US President is also hiking tariffs on Chinese imports, raising the rate from 10% to 20%.
Sensex, Nifty in red as Dalal Street bloodbath continues: 3 reasons whyThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 265.30 points to 72,820.64, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 104.85 points to 22,014.45 as of 9.40 am.
Who should not have coffee? Excessive caffeine intake (more than 400-600 mg daily) can interfere with iron absorption, leading to thinning bones, early ageing, and even anxiety and insomnia.
Big sea snafu brewing in KeralaAn amendment bill that has given the Centre control over Kerala's coastal waters faces fierce resistance from people and politicians across party lines

Man earning Rs 82,000 a month says it's not enough. Reddit post sparks debateA man who claimed to have been earning Rs 82,000 a month said it was not enough for him to run a family due to a hefty home loan.

This is injustice, I should attend last rites: Father of UP woman executed in UAEThe father of Shahzadi Khan, a woman from Uttar Pradesh's Banda, who was executed in the UAE last month, said it was an injustice for him and demanded the government return her body home.
Actor Millie Bobby Brown calls out trolls who body shamed her: This is bullyingMillie Bobby Brown, famed for Stranger Things, spoke out against body-shaming, highlighting it as a form of bullying.

2 men force Pune teen to get intimate with uncle, then take turns raping herTwo men allegedly raped and robbed a 19-year-old woman at a knifepoint in front of her maternal uncle after forcing them to get intimate and recording the act in Maharashtra's Pune.

Bryan Johnson's description of human vascular system leaves Internet dividedUS billionaire Bryan Johnson shared an image of the human vascular system and called it "beautiful". However, social media users were divided on his take as several found it "scary."

India rejects UN's 'cherry-picked' claims on J&K, Manipur: Look in the mirrorIndia condemned the UN rights chief's remarks on Kashmir and Manipur as 'unfounded' and 'baseless', highlighting regional progress and criticising the global update's "cherry-picking" and misrepresentation of complex issues.

Blue Ghost sends breathtaking picture of first sunrise on the MoonThe photo taken by Firefly Aerospace's Blue Ghost lander captures the beautiful sunrise with the Sun's rays shining bright with deep craters shown on the Moon.

Bangladesh's Yunus says India ties strong, seeks to clear 'misunderstandings'Bangladesh Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus sought to ease tensions with New Delhi, stating that efforts were underway to resolve misunderstandings and reinforce bilateral cooperation.

Focus on diet and exercise: New guidelines for fatty liver disease treatmentAccording to the new guidelines, combining diet and structured exercise training can benefit the liver and cardiometabolic health.

Wall Street crashes as Trump says 25% tariffs on Canada, Mexico to go aheadStock markets tumbled in the US as President Donald Trump confirmed that 25 per cent tariffs on goods from Mexico and Canada would come into effect on Tuesday.

Dragon actor Pradeep Ranganathan addresses comparisons with DhanushActor and director Pradeep Ranganathan opened up about comparisons with Dhanush. Pradeep's latest release, Dragon, earned over Rs 100 crore at the box office and is still going strong.

Bobby Deol says he asked for work during low phase: Nothing to be ashamed aboutActor Bobby Deol recently opened up about his struggles and the low phase of his career. Deol said that he has never hesitated to reach out to people for work.

Watch: Kangana Ranaut seeks blessings at Sri Hosa Marigudi Temple in KarnatakaBollywood star Kangana Ranaut visited the Sri Hosa Marigudi Temple in Kapu, participating in the Brahmakalashotsava celebrations.

Abhay Deol 'ran away' from Mumbai after Dev D: Was afraid of getting famousActor Abhay Deol recently admitted that he was so scared of getting attention from people that he ran away from Mumbai to New York City after the release of his film Dev D.

sports.headline: 94 bids, 36,100 USD: Magnus Carlsen's 'Jeansgate' denims gets sold on eBayMagnus Carlsen's infamous 'Jeangate' denims sold for a whopping 36,100 dollars on eBay. Carlsen put the jeans for auction in February this year and the proceedings went to a charity.

India vs Travis Head, not Australia: Fans start meme fest ahead of semi-finalAs India prepare for their Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia, fans are once again wary of Travis Head's threat. Memes and discussions highlight concerns over Head's past dominance, making his wicket a crucial target for India.

Change jersey colour? Aakash Chopra's hilarious take on stopping Travis HeadAakash Chopra joked that India may have to change their jersey colour from blue to stop Travis Head ahead of the semi-final on Tuesday, March 4. Head has tormented India in the recent past by scoring big hundreds in ICC events.

Ravi Shastri suggests India to go with unchanged XI for semi-final Champions Trophy 2025: Ravi Shastri said that India should go in with the same playing for the semi-final against Australia after beating New Zealand in their last Group match on Sunday.

Ricky Ponting wants IPL 2024-mode Jake Fraser-McGurk in semi-final vs IndiaRicky Ponting has urged Jake Fraser-McGurk to replicate his IPL 2024 form as Australia face India in the Champions Trophy semi-final. With Matthew Short ruled out, Fraser-McGurk's place in the playing XI remains a key decision.

Axar Patel could be India's trump card for Champions Trophy knockout stageAxar Patel has emerged as India's game-changer in the Champions Trophy, delivering match-winning performances with both bat and ball. As India gear up for their semi-final against Australia, his impact could be the defining factor.

India has psychological advantage over Australia in semi-final: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that India will have a psychological advantage over Australia in the semi-final on Tuesday, March 4. India have won all their matches that they have played in Dubai so far.

All the pressure on India in semi-final clash, none on Australia: Brad HaddinFormer wicketkeeper Brad Haddin has claimed that all the pressure will be on India in the semi-final against Australia. Haddin also said that Australia won't have any pressure on them and feels that they can beat India in Dubai.

No 'silencing' talk: Steve Smith breaks from Cummins' playbook before India semisChampions Trophy Semi-Final: Australia captain Steve Smith was reminded of Pat Cummins' famous words from the 2023 World Cup final as he addressed the press on Monday in Dubai. Smith will lead Australia against tournament favorites India in what promises to be a thrilling semi-final.

India's spin overload vindicated as team lays out Varun trap for AustraliaIndia's move to play four spinners against New Zealand worked like a dream in their final group-stage match in the Champions Trophy. Mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy stole the show in his very first outing at the tournament. And that begs the question: Should India continue with the same template in the semi-final match as well?

India's mental block is more against Travis Head than Australia: Dinesh KarthikDinesh Karthik feels that India's mental block in knockout games has been more against Travis Head than Australia as a team. Head has tormented India in the recent past with big knocks in ICC finals.

Haddin also said that Australia won't have any pressure on them and feels that they can beat India in Dubai.

Smith will lead Australia against tournament favorites India in what promises to be a thrilling semi-final.

Mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy stole the show in his very first outing at the tournament. And that begs the question: Should India continue with the same template in the semi-final match as well?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
